New Records: Steph Curry scored 36 points, 25 of which came in the final two quarters.
Key Match Events: Steph Curry torched the OKC Thunder with 17 points in the third quarter to help Golden State outscore the hosts 42-21.
The OKC Thunder bench came alive and trimmed the lead surely and slowly in the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr is using a 12-man rotation that seems to be working for the Golden State Warriors.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors improved to 8-2 for the season after Sunday's victory, while the Thunder will have the same record.
It was just their second defeat of the season and their first one at the Paycom Center.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Golden State Warriors finished the five-game road trip with an impressive 4-1 record.
Steph Curry and the Warriors return home for their next game against the Dallas Mavericks on Nov. 12.
Klay Thompson will make his first game at the Chase Center since leaving the Warriors in free agency on Tuesday.
Others: Jonathan Kuminga scored 20 points off the bench, while De'Anthony Melton had 19 points, 10 rebounds and three steals as a starter. Andrew Wiggins added 18 points, eight rebounds, five assists and three steals.
